Name: Find The King
Description:
Players are given one set of colored cards, either all reds or all blacks. Players are also given one different colored King. To win the game, you have to find your colored king in your opponent's deck. Players lay their full deck face down, choosing which cards go where. Players take turns choosing which cards move around and which ones fight, with highest number winning. Don't loose track of the king, because if you accidentally expose him, you lose!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Towers of Arkhanos: Silver Lotus Order Expansion
Description:
The magic ruins are attracting more and more people, and now a new magic school joins the party: The Silver Lotus Order answer the call of the king to help build the towers.

The Towers of Arkhanos is a fast dice-drafting, tower-building family game of pure magic and fun, and the Silver Lotus Order expansion adds components for a fifth player to join the game, as well as new floor tiles with new pre-requisites to improve variety for the core game.

Name: The Towers of Arkhanos: The Dark Tower Expansion
Description:
The wicked witch noticed that the power of light was growing at the ruins of Gil-Garoth as the towers started going up, and decided to try and stop the magic schools from harvesting the magic stones.

THE DARK TOWER is a expansion from "The Towers of Arkhanos" which adds 3 new modes of play:

1 The SOLO MODE, in which you try and build the towers before the witch builds hers and sends her goblins to get in your way;

2 The Witch's game, a new set of rules to play a game of "Towers of Arkhanos" in a totally different and fun way;

3 And the grand master special ability cards.

The Towers of Arkhanos is a fast dice drafting, tower building family game of pure magic and fun.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Blume: Tools
Description: Mini expansion given to backers during the Blume Kickstarter.  Adds 8 unique tool cards and glove tokens.

Name: Blume: Botanist
Description: Mini expansion given to backers during the Blume Kickstarter.  Adds 15 Botany Cards and 3 Water Beads

Name: Dust in the Wings: Inuit Promo Card
Description:
This promo was available in the Inuit: The Snow Folk box.

Promo consists of 1 Gathering card.

To fulfill it, you must end your move on a space that contains 5 butterflies: 1 red, 1 blue, and 1 yellow butterfly, as well as two other butterflies of any color (as long as they both are of the same color).

Name: Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Pyramid Tile Promo, Red Temple
Description:
This promo adds a new Pyramid tile to the game.

All four icons on the tile are associated with the red temple, with two of them being colored, allowing for a double temple advancement if placed accordingly.

Name: Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Man vs Meeple Promo
Description:
This promo adds a new Royal tile to the game.

When worshiping here, gain 2 victory points for each of your workers currently locked into worship locations (including this one).

In 2020, became available as part of the Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Promo Bundle

Name: Dice Settlers: Towers of Dice
Description:
This promo was available during the 2019 Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.

Promo consists of 1 Technology card with a blue seal.

You need 1 Lantern and presence on Forest (green) and Mountains (gray) territories to research the Technology.

Benefit: Before the Roll phase, put up to 3 dice from your Spent Area back into your bag.

Name: Fashion
Description:
A card game played with a standard deck, designed by Mason Yeater. Using elements of area control games, this simple card game has players competing for scoring areas which range from 1 to 12 using a series of card in their hand.

Players simply lay cards over different scoring areas, and when all cards have been placed the topmost card scores the area. The game is designed to be played over several rounds.

Scoring areas are represented by Jacks, Queens and Kings in all different suits. Players cards range from ace to 10. Players can only play a card that is higher than the previous one played onto a scoring area. An ace, however, resets the area: it can be played onto any card, but any card can be played onto an ace.

The game plays for between 2 to 4 people, with a team-based variant for 4 players.

—user summary

Name: Read My Mind
Description:
Read My Mind is the game of clues and creative connections.

In this game like minds battle rapid thinkers. Write your own ending to a given statement, then try to communicate it to just one other player.

Beware! Your opponents will try to second-guess you and grab your points. Can you get your message across without being robbed by rivals? Can you hijack their efforts and add to your score? Think fast, think smart to make the connection - and don't get lost for words!

The winner is the first to reach the target score. You win points by getting a nominated opponent to be the only player to guess the answer you have devised, or by being first to correctly guess the answer another opponent has devised.

—description from the designer

Name: Brook City: Max Promo Card
Description:
Ally / Rival card handed out at GenCon 2018.

RIVAL
Difficulty: 6
Resistance: Aggressive 2, Standard 1, Cautious 1
Location: K29 (Brickway Warehouses)
Before encountering this target, a cop near this target may suffer 1 stress to reduce this target's resistances by 1.
Activate: Move 6 spaces towards the nearest cop. Then, each cop within 3 spaces suffers 1 stress.
Bust: Discard 1 stress.

ALLY
Health: 6 stress
Aggressive
Exhaust: This ally may move 6 and encounter 2 dice. During this encounter, this ally may suffer 1 stress to gain +1 die.

Name: Big 6
Description:
Big 6 is the fast-thinking bidding game.

Rattle off your answers in this rapid response topics game. You've got just 30 seconds to give the number of answers you have predicted and successfully bid for - the tactic is whether to bid high or low. Dare you outbid your rivals and go for the Big 6? Fail to reach you target and you blow the lot.

If you match your prediction you win a card of the chosen category - the categories are Words, Numbers, People, Places, Things, Random. Collect six of one category card or one of all six to win.

-description from designer

Name: Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar – Formosa Expansion
Description:
Formosa Expansion comprises 8 unique cards depicting six extinct Taiwanese animals. The animals are: Swinhoe's Pheasant, Asian Elephant, Clouded Leopard, Formosan Black Bear, Leopard Cat, and Capybara.

The Formosa Expansion cards are shuffled into the Souvenir deck. Each card has a different effect.

—description from the publisher

Name: He She Him Her
Description: A satirical game where the male army represented by bolts, tries to keep the female army, represented by the brass rings, in the kitchen.

Name: Coder Bunnyz
Description:
A board game with fun and learning for kids, adults and families. 

     13 levels of kinesthetic learning, grows with age or player skills 
     Highly interactive way to introduce coding 
     Teaches all the concepts used in Java, Python, Ruby and even C. 
     Promotes problem-solving and social interaction 


Game Play: 
Easy to get started, focuses on concepts. Program your robot bunny game token smartly with your code cards to eat the carrot and reach the destination before the others do! Play with different destinations or move to the next levels.

Skills covered: 
CoderBunnyz programming board game teaches you coding concepts like: 

     Sequencing 
     Conditional 
     Repeat Loops 
     Code Writing 
     Functions 
     Debugging 
     Branches 
     Inheritance 
     Parallelism 
     Stack 
     Queue 
     List 


—description from the publisher

Name: Connections
Description:
Connections is based on a tested and proven psychological theory known in clinical circles as "Choice Theory".  This game allows players to enjoy the benefits and to learn the psychological lessons of the theory without ever having to crack a book, attend a lecture, or lie on the couch.

—description from the publisher

During the game, players roll and move around the board.  Along the way, they will encounter cards for Connecting Habits, Disconnecting Habits, and Quality World.  Upon giving personal answers to these cards, players will earn points.  The first player to reach 1,000 points wins.

The box contains: board, D6, six player pawns, 33 game cards, 6 escape cards, beginner's guide, score pad, and instructions.

—user summary

Name: Bridges of Budapest
Description:
The Bridges of Budapest is a game about the unification of the cities Buda, Obuda, and Pest in the second half of the 19th Century. These cities sat on either side of the River Danube and only became one when the Szechenyi Chain Bridge was built across the river. In this game, you will design and build the famous bridges and buildings that earned Budapest the soubriquet "The Pearl of the Danube"

On your turn you either: a) place or advance workers on 2 (out of 7) Action Tracks, pushing previously placed workers down into more advantageous spaces; or b) retrieve 1 worker from an Action Track and pay for the resources offered at the space the worker is on. To build a structure, you need to collect a matching blueprint (for a bridge, monument, church, etc.) plus various resources (wood, stone, iron, and/or gold) as specified for the structure being built. Finally, you must claim the building site with the blueprint and deliver the resources needed to that site. On completion, you earn victory points (VPs) and receive a crest from the District where the site is located that will score additional VPs at the end of the game.

The player who contributes most to the construction of Budapest will earn the greatest number of Victory Points and hence win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Outer Banks Vacation Game
Description:
In this family game, in the storytelling style of "The Game of Life", players travel by spin-and-move along a board.  Along the way, they encounter Shopping, Dining, and Family Activity Cards which represent real-world businesses in the Outer Banks area.  By earning Fun Tickets (VPs) and avoiding Vacation Bummer Cards, players vie to have the highest score after all players reach the finish line.

The box contains: quad-folding board, six pawns, spinner, Fun Tix money, Shopping Cards, Dining Cards, Vacation Bummer Cards, and instructions.

—user summary

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Return to the Path to Carcosa
Description:
You thought that the final curtain had closed on your dealings with The King in Yellow. When the cursed play first came to Arkham, it was followed by a string of disappearances, delusions, suicides, and madness. Throughout The Path to Carcosa cycle, which marked the second full-length campaign for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, your search for answers took you across the sea to the shining lights of Paris and beyond to Dim Carcosa and before the throne of Hastur himself in eight unique scenarios that tested your conviction, made you doubt your senses, and pushed you to the edge of insanity. But now, madness returns to Arkham for an encore performance…

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Path to Carcosa
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Tigers in the Ardennes
Description:
Tigers in the Ardennes is a small-format basically division level hex-and-counter board-wargame of the Battle of the Bulge.  12 day-turns, 16-27Dec44.  Blitzkrieg.

Special rules:  Tiger Fright, Tiger Tank Breakdown, Skorzeny's Brandenburgers, press-your-luck Waffen-SS Ruthless and Consequential GI Rage option...

—description from the designer
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Huvi-matka Avasaksaan
Description:
Huvi-matka Avasaksaan (also in Swedish: Lustfärd till Avasaksa) is a roll and move board game. Published game included a game board with 64 squares, and a rules booklet. Players were required to provide their own game money, suggesting that the game has been played as a low stakes gambling game. In the rules booklet there is a description for each game board square, including the information of money gained or lost in that square.

The theme is a travel trip from Helsinki to tourist location of Aavasaksa and back. This is the first known Finnish board game published.

—user summary

Name: Korsu-peli
Description:
Korsu-peli is an Chess or Stratego like war game played in a grid on 7-by-7 squares. On capture the strengths of the units are compared and the weaker is removed from the board. The goal of the game is to capture the enemy war flag unit or enter into a specific square in opponent's baseline, "Korsu".

—user summary

Name: Vandringen till Lyran
Description:
Vandringen till Lyran (also in Finnish, Vaellus lyyran saantiin) is a roll and move game, where players race in 25 steps to be the first to get accepted into university. Each square either gives or takes money from the players, or pushes them forward or backward. First player to reach the final square then gains all game money in the bank and is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Råttfällan
Description:
Råttfällan is a roll and move game where players are rats trying to collect various food items from the board. If landing on one of those squares, the player will take an amount of game money from the next player, depending on which type of food item it was. Eventually all players are forced into the rat trap in the center of the board as moves are not allowed to go away from the rat trap, only towards it or sideways. The player with most money in the end wins.

—user summary

Name: Main Event Boxing
Description:
Main Event Boxing is a round by round game in which fighter’s will perform uncannily close their real life abilities. In Main Event Boxing, fighters are rated for scoring ability, punching power, endurance, defense, ability to absorb punishment, ability to be knocked down or knocked out, susceptibility to cuts and swelling, and how often a fighter commits a foul.

Main Event Boxing features all of the nuances of professional boxing that you see in real life bouts. Quick KO’s, TKO’s, and close decisions, will all occur on your tabletop with real life accuracy in Main Event Boxing. As in real life boxing, ANYTHING can happen, but you won’t see the flash KO’s and huge upsets with regularity in Main Event Boxing, like you do with other boxing games.

Main Event Boxing is a sequel to FAST Boxing. However, the game has changed a great deal, and it is much more than a ratings update, which is why I gave the game a new name. If you have played FAST Boxing, the game will be somewhat familiar. However, if FAST Boxing wasn’t your cup of tea, I ask you to give this game a look, as it is truly THAT much better.

I always felt that FAST Boxing was a “complimentary game”. It was a game that bridged the gap from a quick playing game, like Ultra Quick Boxing, and a detailed game like Title Bout. Main Event Boxing has shed the “complimentary game” title now. This game stands on its own with the best of them. While the game does play rapidly, and it’s certainly not a punch-by-punch simulation, I stand firmly behind the accuracy of the game. And most importantly, I find the game play to be quite compelling and easy to pick up and play. This ultimately is the most important thing about any game!

Fighters, Fighters, Fighters…

The standard game features a vast array of today’s current boxing stars. With the standard game, you get over 190 heavyweights, 90 Cruiserweights, 78 Light Heavyweights, 94 Super Middleweights, 82 Middleweights, 108 Junior Middleweights, 112 Welterweights, 122 Junior Welterweights, 115 Lightweights, 75 Junior Lightweights, 89 Featherweights, 76 Junior Featherweights, 74 Bantamweights, 76 Junior Bantamweights, 68 Flyweights, 45 Junior Flyweights, and 128 Strawweights. That’s over 1600 active fighters. No other game company can match that! You can rest assured that my research and analysis yields very accurate fight ratings.

The match-ups are limitless!

—description from the designer

Name: Galactic Space Exploration: The Ultimate Space Exploration Game! (Level 1)
Description:
Galactic Space Exploration is a 1-4 player game where you manage your resources, buy and launch dozens of rocket ships, and be the first to head out into the vastness of space in the ultimate space exploration game!  Best for kids aged 6 through 160.

Learn to master the market. Players must invest wisely to grow their resources and their fleet of Rocket Ships. Who will be first to explore the Solar System and the Galaxy?

The year is 2019 and here on planet Earth, we are faced with a big decision. Are we to deplete Earth’s natural resources, surely guaranteeing our species extinction, or will we expand our reach into the solar system and seek the riches outer space has to offer?

This game lets kids of all ages build their space empire by working hard for resources and making one savvy investment, one at a time.

Playing as the CEO of one of 4 space exploration companies, the goal is to be the first player to build their fleet of ships and explore beyond our Solar System. Space awaits - it’s up to you to make smart investments while sending your rocket ships to planets, moons, and eventually out into the Galaxy!

Players and seeking untapped resources for sale on the interplanetary market. You can grow your capital, increase your fleet, and expand your holdings within the Solar System—but one false move, and your organization will be on the wrong end of the space boom.

Will YOU be the first to reach the stars?

—description from the designer

Name: Terror Below: Hidden Cache Expansion
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive component upgrade & expansion box for the game. Contents include:

Bonus Card - Saddle up! 
Tinkerbelle Bonus Pack: 5 New Worms
Wooden Ramp Component & Item Card
Bonus Weapon Card: Experimental Arm Cannon
Bonus Energy Glove Item Card
T.P.K. W.O.R.M. Miniature
Wooden Tank Player Marker
Upgraded Wooden Target Tokens
Bonus Wooden Dice
7 Glow in the Dark Eggs
Banana Chan's Terror Below Physical Story Book
High Resolution Worm Art

Name: Flamme Rouge: Styrkeprøven
Description: A promotional track card for Flamme Rouge. The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

Name: Flamme Rouge: Etape de la Vallée
Description: A promotional track card for Flamme Rouge. The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

Name: Bloodborne: The Board Game – Byrgenwerth
Description: Byrgenwerth is a Kickstarter Exclusive expansion set in an ancient place of learning, and introduces a host of new enemies, a new Boss, and a whole new campaign!

Name: Merchant Princes of Byzantium
Description:
It is a time of chaos in the ancient empire of 14th century Byzantium. Political, social and economic upheavals are pushing the old empire to breaking point. For clever merchants it is a time of great potential. Attempt to accumulate, trade, bribe, trick and manipulate your way to becoming the richest and most influential Merchant Prince in Byzantium.

Game Summary: Players assume the role of an inspired merchant in ancient Byzantium, determined to develop a trading empire across the region of Anatolia during the upheavals of the time. Each player has a different character and special power taken from a range of different neighbouring cultures. Players buy trade goods in far off markets to sell in the bazaars of Byzantium, while doing their utmost to undermine and obstruct their rivals and avoid the various historical hazards of the time. Players use Trader markers to purchase and move goods appearing across the board, avoiding dangerous local events and rival player skulduggery. Later in the game players can attempt to secure influential government roles worth bonus victory points but require each role to be voted upon by all players so bribery and deal making is a must! The player with the largest and most influential merchant empire at game end is given the title of Merchant Prince of Byzantium.

—description from the publisher

Name: Antique
Description:
Antique is an auction game in which each player represents an important collector of the world of art and antiquities.
 Each player will have to manipulate his rivals to get the most valuable collection of the table and pay as little as possible for each of his pieces.

—user summary

Name: Landships: Titanic Battles in The Age of Iron and Steam
Description:
Landships is a tactical miniature wargame system, designed for novice and experienced players. The game is a simple system to learn and play, though there is enough depth that it will take time and experience to master. It is a 1/300 (6mm) steampunk wargame set in the fantastic world of Artrusia, where orcs, humans and other races fight each other.

The main feature of this game is that the miniatures are made to print in 3D printers. The player buys the files and print as many times as he wants. Our goal is to take advantage of these new technologies for wargames and give the player more diverse and cheaper options regarding the miniatures.  We are aware that it is a new technology, but we want to go ahead and serve an audience that is already using 3D printing to play.

—description from the publisher

This basic game contains:

- 1 rulebook in pdf format
- 1 game scenario
- 1 player aid
- Paper Counters to replace 3D miniatures
- Action Cards for printing

Miniatures for 3D printing in STL format

Orcs
- Landship
- Steam Mech
- Light Tank
- Heavy Tank
- Steam Artillery
- Steam Infantry

Humans
- Landship
- Steam Mech
- Light Tank
- Heavy Tank
- Steam Artillery
- Steam Infantry

Tripeds
- Attack Triped

Accessories
- Triped template shoot ruler
- Artillery Templates
- Steam Points
- 2 buildings
- Aerolites

Buy the game here: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/275108/Landships--Titanic-Battles-in-the-Age-of-Iron-and-Steam

Name: Scythe: Modular Board
Description:
The Scythe: Modular Board expansion allows you to change the landscape of Eastern Europa every time you play Scythe thanks to its double-sided game board and four large double-sided landscape tiles. Faction locations, i.e., the home base tiles, change each time you play.

The modular board adds a drafting element to set-up, along with a variant for a tighter map at lower player counts.

Featured Components

• 1 double-sided board (624x818mm, same size as the standard Scythe board)
• 4 double-sided tiles (7 hexes per tile)
• 8 home base tiles
• 8 structure bonus tiles
• 1 rulebook (11 languages)
• Automa rules for solo play

Name: Usurp the King
Description:
The King may be in trouble. The court that surrounds him contains subjects who seek power. Each player represents a family that will vie for control over subjects. Featuring seven victory conditions the path to victory may shift as you gain more information about each subject’s motives and those of the other families. Your allegiances will twist and change based on your interests. The subjects are but pawns.

The game is played over two phases:
INTRIGUE PHASE
Players will gather information, exert influence, and gather resources. Each member of the court has a role, each player may look at 1 role, place an influence token on a court member and select a Leverage card to add to their hand.

REBELLION PHASE
After each player has taken five turns during the Intrigue phase they will keep 5 cards in their hand and set 4 cards aside in their reserve. In order of the Leverage item number, cards will be played to bribe, conspire, stab, poison, and to shift alliances.

SCORING PHASE
One of the unique aspects of this game is the 7 different victory condition. Players may change what condition they are attempting to achieve as the game evolves. After all Leverage cards, the winning player will be determined based on the resulting court conditions (which of the following living court members they control).

     The Usurper will win if two other court members are disgruntled and the Usurper has not been bribed.
     The King will win if the King is alive and the Usurper has not won.
     The Heir will win if the King is dead, the Usurper has not won and the Heir is not disgruntled.
     The Bastard will win if the King is dead, the Usurper and the Heir have not won and the Bastard is not disgruntled.
     If none of the above conditions have been met, the player that controls the most undisgruntled court members will win.
     If none of the above conditions have been met, the player that controls the Anarchist will win
     If none of the above conditions have been met, no player wins (Anarchy).


—description from the publisher

Name: Promise Reborn
Description:
Overview: Promise Reborn is a 2-4 player deck-building game where players try to deliver cards back to their Realm in order to gain Prosperity and win the game. Players begin with 6 cards in their deck, and draw 4 cards for their hand. 4 cards form a main deck is placed in the center row. On their turn, a player plays all the cards from their hand, gaining Strength and other special abilities. Players spend their Strength to either Gather cards to their discard pile, or Deliver cards to their Realm to be scored for Prosperity. At their end of their turn, the player draws 4 cards form their deck, shuffling their discard pile to form a new deck if they ever run out of cards in their deck. When a player has 20 or more Prosperity at the end of a round, the game stops. The player with the most Prosperity wins. The game is light, fast, and fun.

The Story: After the Great Cataclysm the realms of Promise were shattered. Once great empires now lay in ruin. It is time to rebuild our realms, and you have been chosen to help. Explore the realmsscape in search for Artifacts, lost Knowledge, Allies, and key Resources Gather what you find to help you in your quest, or deliver them to your realm to bring prosperity. The realm with the most prosperity will be a beacon of light to all in Promise Reborn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Disney Theme Park Edition III
Description:
This version of Monopoly is the 3rd iteration of the Disney Theme Park Editions, featuring a pop-up Disney castle. They are only sold at Disney resorts and theme parks. The famous rides and attractions are bought, sold, and traded by the players. Toontown buildings act as houses while Disney castles sub for hotels. It features 6 collectible player tokens modelled after Disney characters plus an exclusive partners statue to enhance the board. Once Upon A Time and Happily Ever After cards replace community chests and chance cards. It also features 60 minute speed play rules.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Disney Theme Park Editions

Name: World Cup!
Description:
World Cup! allows players to replay historic soccer tournaments, with control over a number of countries in the competition. The goal is to use strategy, power, and a bit of luck to guide one of your teams to soccer’s ultimate prize!

This reprint of The World Cup Game will shift the design to a card-only format, allowing for more portability, but will maintain the original design of the board game. The revised game will also create individual team abilities, allow players to create their own tournaments (where teams from different eras can face off), and for the first time, allow players to replay the Women’s World Cup.

Players select a number of teams to play throughout the tournament and are dealt "game cards" which add actions (goals, corner kicks, fouls, etc.) to each game. As many games are played simultaneously, players must determine which teams to support on each turn. Each team also has a special ability that gives uniqueness and flavor to the game.

The object of the game is to have one of your teams win the World Cup! Players can replay recent tournaments, or customize tournaments by mixing teams from different eras.

—description from the designer

Name: Stray Cats
Description:
Stray Cats is a quick, fun, easy-to-learn card game to bring a home sweet home for cats. Depending on the current active Paw Law, the players may place the right cat in the going home pile. The first player with no more cards on hand is the winner. But not so fast, there are home cards and a few special cards that change the Paw Law and prevent you from entering your cat cards. Plus all the special effect cards are not allowed to play as the Last Card. The game fits for ages 12+ and 2-6 or 2-8 players depending on deck versions.

—description from the designer

Name: Yat'Z Dungeon Raid
Description:
Your adventure begins on the outskirts of a small village where you have heard tell of a dungeon near the village’s church. The barkeep at the local tavern spoke of adventurers who have entered the dungeon seeking treasures untold, but have never returned. The priest of the church told tales of the blood curdling sounds that creep from behind the dungeon’s locked doors. The information you’ve been given does little to deter you, and others, from the promise of riches and glory. You are sure that your adventures have brought you face to face with far worse than what may await in the bowls of this dungeon. You step up to the locked doors. You feel the familiar rush of adrenaline and nervousness beginning to pound through your body…

Welcome to YAT’Z Dungeon Raid!

—description from the publisher

Name: Quackup: Quack Attack!
Description:
In this turn-based strategy card game from Raytoons Comics, each player must form their own team of characters (from the Quackup comic book series) and must defeat other players through mini game missions and battles! Game missions and conflicts can be resolved through stealth, diplomacy, science, and various other ways depending on the skills your characters possess. The last player left standing is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: Storm over Olympus
Description:
A two-players game derived from Stratego, but asymmetrical and themed in the Greek Mythology universe. Two teams of gods struggle for the dominance of the Olympus - its current occupiers, lead by Zeus, against the Chthonians, entities of the Underworld lead by Hades.

Both players choose a team of 9 out of 12 units. As in Stratego, their pieces identities are hidden from the opponent before they enter combat. Besides their pieces, each side has two important assets, Honor and Energy, which are crucial in their mobility and combat power.

Both sides have different victory conditions: the Chthonians win by moving one of their leaders (Hades or his wife Persephone) into the Olympus top, while the Olympians must simply avoid the Chothonian success by eliminating their leadership from the game. Also, a player loses when ending up with less than 1 Honor point.

—description from the designer

Name: Terraforming Mars: Turmoil Promos
Description: These promos were included in the Kickstarter for Terraforming Mars: Turmoil, the fifth expansion for Terraforming Mars.

Name: Everwar
Description:
- Introduction -

Everwar is a fast, fun and accessible wargame, with a diesel punk aesthetic and a pixel art graphic design, very characteristic of mid'90s video games (hello Advance Wars!). The universe of Everwar is based on a fun and solid game system (easy to learn but hard to master) which develops an interesting plot that, in addition to providing a rich background, regularly introduces new mechanics and playable elements that add depth and freshness to the gaming experience through regular updates.

- Background -

The story of Everwar is set in an alternative universe that shares certain similarities with our own world. The events take place in Domum, a planet where the technological advance of humanity has evolved exclusively around internal combustion engines and fossil fuel.

In Domum, wars between nations have occurred on a global scale on numerous occasions throughout recent history. This has molded belligerent societies accustomed to enduring the sacrifices of long confrontations.

The base game of Everwar brings us to Erisland Kingdom, a nation that is mired in a bloody civil war for the succession to the throne. But something is about to change the course of history in a terrible way, and neither Erisland, nor any other nation of Domum, is prepared for it.

- Gameplay overview -

During a game of Everwar, the player's objective is to fulfill one of the scenarios victory requirements. This may include collecting a certain amount of victory points, capturing an enemies HQ or taking control of strategic objectives.

To do so, players will take non-consecutive turns in which the initiative is based on the orders issued to their armies.

Every turn, players will simultaneously choose orders that will allow them to move and engage in combat with a different number of units. Initiative is determined by the number of units activated by an order, the player activating the least number of units will gain the initiative during the turn.

Everwar has a dice-based combat that uses a rock(tanks)-paper(artillery)-scissor(infantry) system to determine the number of dice each player gets. This, together with terrain bonuses and flank bonuses, brings a fast and simple yet highly tactical combat experience.

Name: Dungeonology: Rigor Mortis
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion that adds the following:

- 4 Scholar Models
- 1 Boss Model
- 6 Zone Tiles
- 3 Standard Cards
- 7 Tarot Cards
- 15 Mini Cards

Name: Dungeonology: Leonardo's Workshop
Description:
Expansion that adds Team vs. Team to the game as well as several new components:

- 1 Mechalisa Model
- 1 Leonardo Model
- 1 Architect Model
- 5 Spiderbot Models
- 20 Zone Tiles
- 23 Standard Cards
- 5 Tarot Cards
- 4 Mini Cards

Name: Dungeonology: Erasmus
Description:
Contains eight new Randomizer Cards, four new Scholars, and two new Note Boards for 5-6 player games.

Content:
- 4 Scholar Miniatures
- 4 Scholar Cards (tarot size)
- 8 Randomizer Cards (mini size)
- 2 Note Boards
- 1 Cat Master Card (poker size) and this Card in six other languages (IT/FR/DE/SP/PL/ZH)
- 1 Mystical Masks Card (poker size) and this Card in six other languages (IT/FR/DE/SP/PL/ZH)
- 10 Tokens
- 1 Rulebook seven languages (EN/IT/FR/DE/SP/PL/ZH)

Name: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Dice Tower Room Promo Tile
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Adds the "Dice Tower Room" tile, which scores 2 points for each of the following rooms built in the castle: "Scythe Room", "Vineyard", "Game Storage" and "Between Two Rooms".
Families: Game: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig
Game: Castles of Mad King Ludwig

Name: Dungeonology: Rocca Civetta
Description:
All components in the base game that were exclusive to Kickstarter backers and not to be released in retail.

This includes:
- Rocca Civetta's Box with plastic tray
- 1 Manticore mini
- 1 Yocca mini
- 2 Floor I Tiles

Black Rose Wars Crossover Materials:
- 1 Stone Collector Forgotten Spell
- 1 Scholar Andromeda Evocation Card
- Manticore Pet Card

Sine Tempore Crossover Materials:
- Crono Relic Equipment Card
- Yocca Pet Card

The Winter Cycle Exclusives:
- 1 Boss: Freddo
- 1 Thermal Baths Zone Tile
- 8 Hot Water Tokens
- 1 Frozen Campus Tile
- 6 Iota Student Minis

The Fourth Floor Exclusive:
- Scholar:  Sara Loft

Middara Crossover Exclusive:
- Boss: Shadowlord

The Adventure Cycle Exclusive:
- Boss: Enrico

Sword and Sorcery Crossover Exclusive:
- Scholar: Onamor

The Cycle From the Future Past Exclusives:
- Boss: Jukas (Sine Tempore Crossover)
- 1 Time Landing Zone Tile
- 1 Crippled Mind Jinx Card
- 3 Clan Cards
- Scholar: Andromeda (Black Rose Wars Crossover)
- 1 Ancient Machine Zone Tile
- 1 Destroyer Beam Jinx Card
- 2 Intern Cards (Brute and Fortune-Teller)
- 3 Trick Cards
- 3 New Student Minis

Name: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig: Saxophone Room Promo Tile
Description:
Originally available as part of the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

Adds the "Saxophone Room" living room tile, which scores 1 point for each adjacent living room tile.
Families: Game: Between Two Castles of Mad King Ludwig
Game: Castles of Mad King Ludwig

Name: Ad Astra
Description: The Game of Interstellar Empire Building. A game of interstellar conquest, diplomacy and economics. The game concentrates on the military competition by the major political powers within a region for control of economic resources, and hence domination of the region. Many minor worlds scatter the region and act as flashpoints for conflict between the major worlds. Comprised a large hex star map, a 42-page A4 booklet and two sheets of stiff card counters (not pre-cut). This is a hex-based wargame with diplomacy elements. One scenario (Power Struggle after the Collapse) is provided along with guidance for how to create your own. The game is designed to be highly customizable.

Name: ひゃっぴきいっしゅ (Hyappiki Isshu)
ヘゲモニア戦記 (Epic of Hegemonia)
In Tents
Description:
A family-friendly game where players will pass cards, match cards in their hand and in the middle while trying to avoid mother nature cards.
The game is played over a series of rounds. Players with the most matching cards of one color or of one illustration will win the round. Each Mother Nature card in their hand will subtract out one match. 1 Point is awarded for winning the round, 2 points if the player with the most matching cards did it with only Mother Nature cards. The first player to earn 5 points wins the game.
Each player is given a scorecard. The card is turned to track the number of points a player has earned.

—description from the designer

Name: YSNP
Description:
In this game, your goal is to build defensive towers in order to neutralise hordes of monsters flowing through your kingdom.
This is a Tower Defense game in a medieval fantasy universe on a piece of cardboard/paper, free to print & play.

There are 4 phases in a round:

     Monsters deployment
     Tower building or upgrading
     Towers activation
     Monsters movement


End of game:

     If the Necromancer reach your village tile, you lose.
     If there is no Tower left around your Kingdom, you lose.
     If the Necromancer and every other Monsters have been discarded, you win.


2-players mode:
The 2-players mode requires two sets of the base game and plays with the same rules, in cooperation.

—user summary

Name: Endeavor: Age of Expansion
Description:
In Endeavor: Age of Expansion, players will take the mechanisms they know and love and use them with a new set of buildings and cards for all-new game play and interaction.

The new building market creates a totally different strategic experience within the same rule set. Most of the actions on the buildings are familiar, but new concepts include trade, fortify, and conscription & mobilization.

Age of Expansion also comes with a new set of Asset cards. All of the cards feature a new and interesting distribution of symbols.

Name: Ants
Description:
The game consists in placing ants in order to create the largest area with pheromones of your color. It is a tile placement game with a piling system and ants-themed. The game is free to print & play!

At the beginning of the game, players chose who will play as brown and who will play as beige.
Each turn a player must draw a tile and add it to his/her hand. He/She then chooses one for the two tiles in his hand and places it in the game area. To place a tile, at least two of the six edges must connect to a tile already present. It is possible to stack a tile on top of others if there is no empty gap underneath (the rule of the 2 edges connection does no apply in this case).

The game ends when all tiles have been placed. The player with the largest area of his color wins.

—user summary

Name: 色映に生へど～いろはにおえど (Iroha ni Oedo)
Description:
è‰²æ˜ ã«ç”Ÿã¸ã©ï½žã„ã‚ã¯ã«ãŠãˆã© (Iroha ni Oedo) is a trick-taking game in which players score face value for the lowest card they win in each suit, while subtracting a point for any additional cards won in that suit.

The game uses 60 cards (twelve each in five colors), but the cards used varies by player count. Players must follow any suit previously played to a trick, not strictly the lead suit.

—user summary

Name: Geek Out! The 80's Edition
Description:
Geek Out! is a party game that can determine once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite pop culture subjects!

In the game, you draw cards asking you to list a certain number of things which fall under a certain category: comic books, fantasy, games, science fiction, and miscellaneous. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!) by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to "out-geek" their friends. Collect a predetermined number of cards, and you win!

Geek Out! The 80's Edition features 350 questions about 1980s pop culture. Radical!

Name: Geek Out! The 90's Edition
Description:
Geek Out! is a party game that can determine once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite pop culture subjects!

In the game, you draw cards asking you to list a certain number of things which fall under a certain category: comic books, fantasy, games, science fiction, and miscellaneous. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!) by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to "out-geek" their friends. Collect a predetermined number of cards, and you win!

Geek Out! The 90's Edition features 350 questions about 1990s pop culture.

Name: Blitzkrieg Commander: 4th Edition
Description:
Blitzkrieg Commander is an exciting wargame that allows you to recreate battles of the Second World War using miniatures on a tabletop.

     Suitable for any scale miniatures, from 2mm right up to 28mm.
     Simple command system that emphasizes the fog of war. 
     Effective mechanism for casualty resolution.
     Flexible figure ratio meaning one base represents a platoon.
     Minimal setup time, simply assemble your forces and play.
     Contains 44 army lists covering all nations and theatres.
     Includes 15 scenarios.
     Suitable for solo, two player or multi-player games.
     No supplements, everything you need to play WWII games in one book.


—description from the publisher

Name: Cards Against Colonialism
Description:
"A Party Game For Indigenant Peoples"

We are stronger when we laugh. This game confronts difficult issues and helps raise discussions. Humor makes it easier to talk about difficult issues. CAC attempts to embrace the modern Native Culture, and allows us to learn and laugh at the same time.

The eldest player starts as the Emcee and draws a red card. He or she reads aloud the question or fill-in-the-blank phrase on the red card. Everyone, including the Emcee, holds ten white cards, and answers the question or fills in the blank(s) by passing one (or two) white cards face down, to the Emcee.

The Emcee shuffles all of the answers and shares each card combination with the group. After all the card combinations are read, every player votes on their favorite response by placing their token on that white card. The player who submitted the card with the most tokens wins that round and keeps the red card. After the round, everyone draws back up to ten white cards, and the duties of the Emcee pass to the person on the left. The player who is first to collect five red cards is declared the Token Indin'.

—user summary

Name: King's Gambit
Description:
Once upon a time, the King decided to talk a nice walk through the forest. As the day drew on, the King wandered deeper and deeper into the forest until suddenly he found himself lost and separated from his Guards. "I'm lost! I'm lost!" shouted the King. The King's Guards heard the King's cry for help, but they too were lost in the ever changing forest. They searched frantically for hours for the King, but to no avail. They were not the only ones in the forest that day searching for the King for unbeknownst to them...there were Assassins afoot!

King’s Gambit is a hand held 18-card solo game. The goal of King’s Gambit is simple: 1) defeat all four Assassins in the forest, OR 2) find the King (who is lost in the forest), and escort him safely through the forest back to the Castle. To do that, you must outwit the Assassins who are trying to kill the King. The Assassins can also wound you! The King’s guards (who are also lost in the forest) can protect the King and you as well...if you can find them. The King also has Allies who can help you in your noble quest, but the King also has Enemies who will hinder your quest. Don’t lose your way, or you too might get lost in the ever changing forest!

—description from the designer

Name: Truck in the Muck
Description:
Compete in this 2-player mint tin format game to deliver food aid in an under-developed country.  Upgrade your truck to survive as the roads deteriorate in bad weather.  Watch out for rebel road blocks, landmines and flat tires!

Event cards and changing weather influence players' decisions as they prepare and load their trucks in the HQ, then travel through their Zone to deliver aid and increase their reputation.  The first player to reach the end of the reputation track and make it back to the HQ is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Slanguage
Description:
Slanguage is a party game in the spirit of Balderdash and Wise and Otherwise. But Slanguage uses international slang as its base.

One player is designated as the Reader each round. That player reads the literal translation of a slang phrase and states the country of origin. The other players write an explanation of the meaning of the slang keeping it secret from other players. They pass their guesses to the reader.

The reader shuffles the written guesses and then reads them to the group without telling who wrote which guess.

Finally, players vote for the explanation that they think is correct. Players score points for getting the correct answer.  They also get points if someone else guesses theirs as the correct answer.

—description from the designer

Name: Farming Dice
Description:
Farming Has Never Been So Dicey!

Roll the dice. Send some carrots to the LEFT. Send some apples to the RIGHT. Send some wheat to the BANK. And take back your broccoli. Just don't let anyone control your entire crop or you're out of the game! Farming has never been so dicey!

Object of Farming Dice is to be the last farmer with tokens. Farming Dice requires some strategy and a little luck of the dice. The roll of the dice determines which crops to move, but the player decides where the crop goes – and if you play it strategically, you can eliminate a farmer from the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fantactics
Description:
Legendary Multi-unit Tactics

Cooperative Play with 2 teams

Take cover, use opportunity fire.

Flank, use tactical abilities.

Join or leave a game in progress.

"Like Chess for Parties"

—description from the publisher

Name: Inferno sugli Altipiani: Valsugana
Description:
Expansion for "Inferno sugli Altipiani, 1916" released with the issue #3 of the Italian wargaming magazine ”ParaBellum".

It adds a new scenario, Valsugana, with a new little map, a set of additional counters and specific rules and scenario instructions.

—user summary
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Aventuria: Inn of the Black Boar
Description:
“Apprehend these traitors!” shouts the Count. “I am surrounded by spies!”

All your protestations of innocence are of no use. A dozen guards grab you, disarm you, take your valuables, and tie you up. After they have left, one of you grabs the knife with tied hands and cuts their neighbor’s bonds. It is pitch dark around you, you are exhausted and only equipped with the scantiest weapons, but the fear of an uncertain fate at dawn drives you forward, into the darkness…

The Inn of the Black Boar is an expansion for Aventuria: the Adventure Card Game published in 2016. The Inn of the Black Boar includes four new heroes: the honorable Amazon Warrior, Palinai Erlendur of Kurkum, the streetwise Grolm Merchant, Neerax Dal, the mysterious Maraskan Buskur, Nicole Sororis, and the battle-hardened Tobrian Mercenary, Heigan Malleaux.

Although all four of these new heroes are ready to drop into Duel Mode, the heart of this expansion is its amazing new exploratory dungeon crawl. Based on the very first adventure for The Dark Eye™ of the same name, the Inn of the Black Boar uses random Dungeon Cards and 20 different random combat encounters so that the adventure is completely different every time you play, making it the most replayable Aventuria expansion yet!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Aventuria: The Return to the Inn of the Black Boar
Description:
The Return to the Inn of the Black Boar is a mini-expansion for Aventuria: The Inn of the Black Boar.

Do you want to explore with even more people? The Return to the Inn of the Black Boar mini-expansion adds enough specialty cards to allow up to 6 players to head into the Black Boar together. But you’ll want to pick this up even if you play solo or with a smaller group, because it also includes cards and combat scenarios for two new factions you can encounter in the dungeon under the Black Boar: the Black Mages and the Undead Circus!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: Dig & Play Egyptian Tomb
Description:
Join the search for priceless Egyptian treasures. Dig up dazzling jewelry and ancient artifacts, then set off to discover the whereabouts of a mysterious Egyptian tomb. It’s an excavation adventure and a cool board game too!

The aim of the game is to be the first to find the hidden Egyptian Tomb. The person who throws the highest number starts first. The first to reach Egyptian Tomb wins. If you throw the dice and the number is too large, you move forward to the tomb and then backwards the remaining spaces. You must throw the exact number.

It may sound simple to reach the Egyptian Tomb first, but you will encounter many obstacles along your journey. Watch out by scorpions and try not to fall in the river or you will find yourself behind your competitors. It’s an exciting adventure full of mystery and danger.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ardennes 2024
Description: "Ardennes 2024" is an alternative history wargame in which German attack on the Western Europe takes place not in 1940, but in the 2024.

Name: Comic Creator
Description:
Comic Creator is an engine-building dice game about the difficulties of being a manga creator.

Collect skill cards to increase your dice pool or use your dice more effectively, and recruit Assistant cards for their special abilities. You want to spend dice to get Experience Points (victory points), but the more you can spend at once the more effective they are... should you spend your dice on your engine and save up for a big card or spend them now for a sure thing?

Striking a balance is tough enough without worrying about printer's deadlines!

—user summary

Name: Aggression
Description:
Aggression is a war-game for two players. Each has 100 armies to be distributed in certain countries on a map which is drawn at the start of the game. A series of battles are then fought with the object of neutralising enemy armies. The player retaining control of the most countries is the winner. There are three phases, in each of which the same player moves first.

Phase 1: The players take turns to delineate one country on the map. This is done by drawing the boundary lines of a single enclosed area on a piece of plain paper. There are no restrictions on the size, shape or location of the countries, though it is recommended that they be drawn reasonably large. Twenty countries are to be drawn in the standard size game.

Phase 2: The players take turns to allocate some of their armies to one unoccupied country. The number of armies allocated is written into the country concerned and that country is then regarded as occupied. The player taking first turn should identify his own allocations by boldly underlining his figures. Phase 2 continues until all countries are occupied or until both players have allocated all of their 100 armies.

Phase 3: The players now take turns to conquer one or other of the opponent's countries. A country may be conquered if there are more of your armies in adjacent countries than your opponent has in the country under attack. Similarly your opponent may conquer one of your countries, at his turn, if he has a superiority of armies in adjacent countries. To qualify as "adjacent", countries must have a visible length of common boundary. The number of armies in the conquered country is crossed out and they take no further part. The armies carrying out the attack are in no way depleted and may be used for other attacks later in the game. The object of the game is to retain more of your own occupied countries than the opponent retains of his. Note that countries you conquer don't contribute to your score but merely reduce your opponent's score by one as he will have retained one less country at the end of the game.

The best strategy depends, in complex ways, upon the original map. Several tips are:


     Create "buffer" countries to protect weak countries during phase 2.



     Avoid crowding enemy-held countries at the start of phase 3.



     The first countries to attack in phase 3 are not necessarily the strongest of the enemy-held countries, but those which, by teamwork, can most damage your position.


—Eric Solomon, Games with Pencil and Paper

Name: Concise Collection of Classes: New Classes and Character Options for Four Against Darkness
Description:
This supplement for Four Against Darkness presents you with nine new character classes, including rules to bring them to up to Expert level with Four Against the Abyss. Featuring:

     the assassin, who hides to deliver astounding killing blows
     the fire elf, who is blind but gifted with the deadly gaze of fire
     the harlequin, who can juggle and fight with three swords
     the lutin, a brownie who can turn invisible and play tricks
     the marksman, whose lightning-fast shots are deadly
     the monk, a specialist deadlier than the warrior, with deadly skills
     the ogre mercenary, a slow but indestructible powerhouse
     The elder, who lends his skills and guides party members
     The wilderness guide, your best friend in the wilds


The second section of this book describes six dwarven clans, each with a set of skills exclusive to dwarf characters, which can be taken from 3rd level, as well as dwarven patrons with unique benefits and drawbacks, some of which can join your party.

Will you fight for the Miner clans who master rune magic and disciplined warfare, the animist Pelter clan savages, the obsessive Dragonslayers, the martial artist Iron Hands with their grafted weapons, the desperate Outcasts or the evil Possessed?

Last but not least are rules for crossbows and harquebuses.

—description from the publisher

Name: Game of the Elections
Description:
A really simple and fun board game based on the greek elections of 1989. It can be played from 2 to 5 players. Each player takes the pawn of a political leader and his goal is to be the first player who reaches the endpoint (number 100), and become the new prime minister of Greece. 
 There are many spots/numbers on the board, whιch when you reach them you can go forward or backwards, lose your turn or be eliminated of the game.

—user summary

Name: Citizens United States of America 1920-1933
Description:
The American Prohibition Period have been marked by a terrific escalation of violence and by a limitation of citizen's freedom.

Will you be able to take advantage of this situation and to emerge from anonymity? Will you be able to build your legacy? Will you promote your own interest or will you follow the law?

Citizens is a EuroGame width a strong direct and indirect interaction. The game round is composed by as many turns as the number of players. Each player performs the following 3 moves:
draw a TURN card, choose and perform an action between those still available and score any Victory Point, legality point or money gained.

The TURN card shows a simplified sketch of the 9 neighbourhoods of the map board. Thee colours of the card show the activated neighborhoods and, subsequently, the active players.The player/s who own business in the neighbourhood indicated by the colour of the current year is defined active and can perform the
action chosen by the current player.

Each player gains VP starting new business in a neighborhoods and selling the barrels.

Victory can be achieved in 2 different ways: a player catches the next player on his left on the VP track and at the end of the 12th turn (year) determining who has scored the most VPs.

—description from the designer

Name: Revenge of the Necromancer
Description:
“Revenge of the Necromancer” is a fast-paced solitaire game of magic and monsters from Wrectangle Games

The Kingdom of Kir has killed your Master, and now they come for you, his Apprentice. With the villagers at your door, assemble the tattered remnants of your Master’s spell book. If you can piece together the right glyphs, you can summon enough dangerous creatures to overwhelm Kir or perhaps even raise The Master himself to seek his revenge….

To piece together the Master's spell book players draw three cards at a time, interacting with each card left to right.  If the card is a glyph fragment it is put into play in front of the player.  If the card is a BASH! card it is set aside but not discarded.
Once two glyphs have been assembled and the monsters summoned, you win!
BUT, if you have drawn 8 BASH! cards the villagers have kicked in the door and you loose.

—description from the designer

Name: Squex
Description:
Squex is a 2-player abstract connection game, similar to Hex.
The game is played on a 8x8 board of octagons and squares. The goal of each player is to connect their corresponding sides of the board with a continuous line of pieces.

How to play:

     On their turn, each player can place one octagonal piece on any free octagonal place on the board.
     If a piece is placed diagonally to a piece of the same color, a square of that color is placed to connect them (it is possible to place up to 4 squares by placing just one octagon).
     If a piece is placed diagonally to a piece of the same color and there is a square of the opponent's color in between them, the opponent's square is replaced by a square of the player's color. The opponent's octagons are no longer connected by the square that was there. This is called a "cut".
     Whenever a player performs a "cut", the opponent can then play two times in a row (it should be noted that if a player performs a "cut" on the first of two consecutive turns, they lose the second turn and it's the opponent's turn to play twice).
     A player only wins when they connect their respective sides of the board and it is impossible for the opponent to ever break that connection with a "cut". Usually after a player connects two sides there are still three of four more turns until the connection is "uncutable".


—description from the designer

Name: Battle for Blastoff
Description:
Navigate the streets of Earth and be the first to escape!  A street smart safety game developed by the Government of Alberta as a tool for teacher's to help students stay safe on the streets.

A tile laying game where you need to move your aliens (safely) around a city, crossing streets, in order for them to reach their mothership and escape home.

—user summary

Name: Wildlands: Map Pack 2 – The Fall of the Dark House
Description:
This board expansion for Wildlands gives players three new maps, two of which are specifically designed for two players. Each map features new rules, new challenges, and new opportunities.

Once the home of one of the Empire's grandest family, the Dark House lies as an epitaph to their fall. As you fight your way across the two-storied Mansion map, you will find remnants of their wicked ways. Out back, struggle through the Hedge Maze map, sinister and long overgrown with vicious thorns. Down below, in the Crypt map, encounter the deadly curse that once cast a noble line into oblivion.

Name: Ice Fox: A Diamond Heist Micro Game
Description:
Ice Fox is a diamond heist/chase theme 18-card micro game for 2 players. One player takes on the role of the world renowned international diamond thief, Ice Fox, whose mission is to elude capture, steal the diamonds in the museum, and escape through the Exit. The other player takes on the role of the Guard trying to capture the elusive Ice Fox and protect the diamonds, Both characters have unique abilities and gain new abilities as the game goes on. Will the Ice Fox's luck run cold, OR will the Guard be put on ice?

The Ice Fox and Guard start on different "tracks" in the museum that only intersect on certain tiles. In each turn, a new tile is added to the map and the player can perform a set number of actions to meet their objective. The Ice Fox can move, turn off lights in a room, and steal a diamond when a diamond room is revealed. The Guard can move, turn on lights in a room, and apprehend. Ice Fox's objective: Get a diamond (or more if you're feeling lucky) and get out. Guard's objective: Capture the Ice Fox!

—description from the designer

Name: Universe of Words
Description:
Amazing Cards Game With Alphabet for adult and kids. Easy to play at home and study new words for kids.


     This game is fun for kids and adults.



     Very suitable to play together in the family when going camping, party...



     Good for thinking and teaching kids new words.



     Help children practice memory and creativity


In Universe Of Words have:


     Number of regular cards: 26x2 = 52 cards
     Double card: On the card contains pairs of letters such as: tr, cr, br, wr, ch, ou, ng, th, qu. Number of 18 cards
     Skip card: Number of 5 cards
     Skipx2 card: Number of cards 5
     Draw card: Number of 10 cards (5 +1 cards, 5 +2 cards)


First, deal each player ten cards and put two cards on two star cells on the table  The remaining cards should be placed face-down, to form the "draw" pile. The first person has to match one of  his/her cards with placed cards on table in order to make a meaningful word. If the player doesn't have anything to match, he/she must pick a card from the draw pile. If he can play what is drawn, great. Otherwise play moves to the next person. You do not have to continue picking up until you come across a card you can match it with placed cards on the table. When you have one card left, you must yell " SOS " (meaning one). If you don't call " SOS" and you get cought by another player, you must pick up two cards from the draw pile. Once a player has no cards left, she/he is the winner. 
“ H” & “ F” card: Except for those who beat this card, the one who slaps his/her hand on the table the slowest must draw 2 cards from the draw pile.
The skip card: this card will skip the person next to you, and let the following player have her turn right away.
The skip cardx2: his card will skip the two people next to you, and let the following player have her/his turn right away.
The draw +1/+2 card: The player next to you will have to pick up one card/ two cards if you play one of these.
The wild card: This type of card lets you change the letter on your card. For example, if you don't have anything to match, you can throw drown the wild card and announce the letter you want to change.
The reverse card: If you play that card, then the order of play is reversed. Instead of the player on your left playing after you, it will pass to the one on your right. In other words, if play is proceeding clockwise, this card will change it to counter-clockwise.

Name: MONSTER MUTATION
Description:
IT TAKES A MONSTER TO CREATE ONE.

Monster Mutation is a very simple game to learn and can be played by 2 to 4 players. The age mark is 5 years of age, but even more feeble minded creatures will be able to simply have a lot of fun creating their own unique 
and gross mutations.

GOAL 
The goal of Monster Mutation is to earn points by assembling 
disgusting monsters. When the game ends, you will be awarded points for monsters with most eyeballs, most fins, longest monster, largets monster ect.

CARDS 
There are three types of cards:

1. Missions: There is a total of 10 mission cards that each layer are fighting over during the game. The mission cards decribe what type of monster combinations might give you points at the end of the game. Each mission card has its specific requirements on how to obtain its one point value. There is a total of 10 different missions. See details on the back of each mission card.

MONSTER PARTS
There are various monster part cards:
A. Red/weapons Allows a mutation to eat meat.
B. Green/mouths allow a mutation to eat plants.
C. Blue/Finns allow a mutations to swim.
D. Purple/Legs allow a mutation to run.
E. Yellow/Eyes allow a creature to see better.
F. Connecters have multible open endings and allow you to build        larger creatures.(Size matters).

3. Hourglass: This card can be used to define when the game ends.

SET UP THE GAME
All monster part cards are placed in a single pile in the middle of the table, it is referred to as the monster part pile. The mission cards are all placed face up, next to each other so the possible missions can be seen.

START THE GAME
Place the hourglass card face down some where in the lower half of the monster part pile. The more players you play the further down in the pile you should place it. You can also choose to exclude the hourglass card, and simply play until the monster card pile is empty.

EACH TURN
1. Draw 2 cards from the monster card pile.
2. Place the monster cards face up on the table in front of you.
3. You may connect monster parts that fits together (as shown below).
Note that you may only have a maximum of three unfinished monsters at the same time. Once a card has been put together with another, they are locked in place and may not be separated.

FITS TOGETHER In order for two monster parts to fit together, their open endings must have the same size. Thin part endings cannot be connected to thick part endings, vice versa.

UNFINISHED MONSTER A unfinished monster is one who has one or more open endings. A single part also counts as a unfinished monster.

GAME ENDS The game ends when the hourglass card has been drawn. 
All unfinished creatures instantly dies, and are put away. 
As they may not be included in the final score.
WINNER The winner of the game is the one who earns the most mission cards. If two or more players has reached the same amount of a spescific mission card requirements the point goes to no one.

Are YOU a MONSTER?

—description from the publisher

Name: Vortex: Snakes #11A
Description:
Expansion for Vortex, adding "snakes", lines with an arrow-shaped end for different puzzles and gameplay. For this version the snakes are red and blue

—user summary

Name: Math Kings
Description:
You are a savvy merchant using basic arithmetic to earn as much gold as possible. Your goal is to acquire assets in the four suits of a standard deck of cards to gain prominence in different aspects of society, and more importantly; to gain influence with the royal court.

Math Kings is a two player game that is played in 20-30 minutes with a standard deck of playing cards. Players alternate taking turns buying cards or earning gold using a 3 x 3 display of cards. Cards cost the "square" of their value, and you earn gold by multiplying the values of cards of the same suit.

Face cards offer special abilities, and are acquired by players as they collect cards of the same suit.

The rules are one page long, and are posted in the "Files" section. Try the game out for free with that crusty old deck of cards you've got lying around and post your feedback in the "Forums" section!

Name: Army of Flanders
Description:
Army of Flanders is the thirteenth volume in Red Sash Games’ Lace Wars series. This game is the third in a set of four dealing with the War of the Grand Alliance (1688-1697). This war, sometimes called the War of the League of Augsburg or
the Nine Years War, was the second of the three great wars of Louis XIV. As a young man he waged the Dutch War to expand
France’s borders. That was a war of aggression. As an old man he fought the War of the Spanish Succession to put his grandson
on the throne of Spain. Despite the King’s ultimate aim, that was a defensive war. The War of the Grand Alliance was Louis’ war of middle age – a war of grinding attrition involving nearly a million men.

In Army of Flanders, you will have a chance to change history – and even if you cannot, perhaps you can win enough glory to
write your name in the history books. Flanders is the source of Gloire, and the graveyard of reputations.

As the French, will you pursue an offensive or a defensive strategy? The French Army is state-of-the-art. You have more artillery, the latest equipment (bayonets instead of pikes), and acess to an administrative machine capable of supporting nearly 500,000 men. But you are under the eye of Versailles, only a couple of day’s ride from the front. You are merely an extension of the King’s will. If his reputation needs patching up, expect to be ordered to lay siege to some massive fortress. At least you will have the resources. But, if the King decides to pursue diplomacy, you will have to secure and ‘rationalise’ the frontier. If you fail, you will lose the respect of the Sun King and the Court ladies. IF you disobey… it does not bear thinking about.

As the Allied commander you lead a motley collection of troops: Dutch, British, Spanish, German, Huguenot, and even the not
inconsiderable army of Liège. The Germans want to pursue a Rhine strategy. The Spanish want to hunker down and let the Dutch
do all the fighting. The British Isles are still being subjugated by the Prince of Orange, though much of the populace supports him.In the early years it will be enough to hold the line. Later, hopefully, the enemy will run out of steam and you can pay him back in his own coin!

Like the other games in the series, Army of Flanders focuses on the operational art rather than tactics or grand strategy. You are the theatre commander, subject to dictates from on high and only partially able to guide the action. Your main goal is to acquire Prestige. Your playing pieces represent battalions and regiments, which you must deploy wisely, deciding how strong to make your garrisons, and how many units to group into mobile formations for attack or defence. These formations are commanded by Leaders, rated for their skill and their temperament (and their political pull), and assisted by Auxiliaries. These last are specialists such as grenadiers and pioneers. Once you are organised, be sure you pick the right time to fight. You have a large army, but it is not infinite! The combat system has a tactical feel, addressing the key issues of frontage, reserves, and supports, as well as firepower and morale. Sieges depend on good planning. Screen your besieging army with another to keep the enemy at bay and make sure you have lots of siege guns and sappers. Supply is critical. You can live of the land, but it is safer to build a string of depôts. Operational tempo is driven by the accumulation of ‘operations points’, which must be expended in order to act aggressively. A player may have the Initiative for a while and dictate the pace of the game, but eventually, he will run out of steam and have to pause to accumulate more points.

Special rules in Army of Flanders deal with the imposition of
strategy from above, the discord of allies, the War of the Two
Kings in Ireland, and the campaigning along the Moselle Valley, which was the highway to the Rhine, just off the map.

The game ends when peace breaks out – something you have little control over – so be sure to acquire Prestige as fast as you can!

—description from the publisher

Name: DreadBall: Glambek Ghosts Ada-Lorana Team
Description:
Outside the Co-Prosperity Sphere, the Ada-Lorana are arbiters of justice. They will not break rules; at least not those set by the DGB, but the rules of physics are another matter entirely. They have the ability to phase through solid objects, which takes some serious getting-used-to for their opponents!

—description from the team card

Name: DreadBall: Sulentic Shards Crystallan Team
Description:
The Sulentic Shards were one of the first Crystallan Dreadball teams, putting their natural abilities and talents to good use on the neodurium and enabling them to live a more settled life. Their unique physical characteristics mean that when all of their energies are aligned few teams can match them. When they are not, then there is always the option of just smashing down anyone who gets in their way.

—description from the team card

Name: DreadBall: Nemion Oceanics Sphyr Team
Description:
The Sphyr are a solid and well-rounded team that draw on the heightened senses of their aquatic ancestry. They are hard to surprise, and are masterful in the use of their fifth limb - their powerful tail. They eschew fancy tactics, but have little in the way of obvious weaknesses. For this reason they are a reliable team that is far harder to beat than many opponents expect.

—description from the team card

Name: Throne of Chickens
Description:
Throne of Chickens is a drafting card game where players choose cards from an ever changing draft pool. To win the game, players must have exactly 6 chickens adding up to the total of their leader card. Standing in the way of victory are either players that will either find the winning combination faster or block you from winning.

—description from the designer

Name: Monster in the Woods
Description:
Monster in the Woods is a card game where 16 cards are placed face down, forming the woods. Player hand size is limited to 2. Players search the woods to find Mei card and Door card in order to escape. However, standing in their way are monster cards and other players.

—description from the designer

Name: Seiya du Sagittaire
Description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.
This goodies was offered in some conventions for free, such as 'Trolls and Legends (Mons, Belgium) edition 2019'.

The Card doesn't change the rules but has its own rules (as the others). On it is written (in French) :
'Arrivée : Si un chevalier d'argent est présent sur le terrain, retirer 1 flamme bleue'
'Vaincu : Retirer Seiya du Sagittaire du jeu puis récupérer en main 1 carte depuis la défausse du terrain'

Name: Böbathüsa
Description:
Böbathüsa is a promotional game of the EUREGIO EGRENSIS, a region spanning parts of Bohemia, Bavaria, Thuringia and Saxonia. The title is an abbreviation of the German words BÖhmen, BAyern, THÜringen and SAchsen.

The game consists of 4 Eurgiocards, plus a set of 10 cards for each region (9 numbered 1-9, 1 wild card). 
Each player gets four cards, five are placed openly on the table. Each player is trying to collect four consecutive cards of the same region, ideally with high numbers. Players can mostly  trade with the table, add a card from the draw pile to the table and discard one, place a hand card in front of them, or trade a hand card with a card in front of them.

The game ends when a player has four consecutive cards in front of them, places all four cards from their hand, or trades a Euregio card with the table. Players note the sum of their consecutive cards (hand cards or laid out cards). The first player to reach 100 points, wins.

—user summary

Name: Clinic: Deluxe Edition – The Extension
Description:
The brand newest CliniC: Deluxe Edition the Extension contains all expansions (at least 12 expansions) already released in the medical dossier #1, medical dossier #2 and medical dossier #3, with new rules, new components, new lay outs and new tiles with new graphics and illustrations from Ian O'Toole.

—description from the publisher

CliniC: The Extension is a boxed expansion which will include ALL expansions (at least 12) already released over the past 5 years. It introduces several new concepts and includes:

-the Amenities (cafeteria, dormitory) with the buses
-the Pharmacy and the Pill tiles
-the Hospice tiles
-the Elders tokens
-the Ambulance tiles
-the Expecting tokens
-the 4th floor new player board
-the Maintenance Shop tiles
-the Janitors pieces
-the Urban Design cards
-the Pillars tiles and tokens
-the Virus tiles and tokens
-the Satellite Dish tiles
-the Intensive Care Unit tile
-the Public Work tiles
